oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mt. Zion AME Zion: cornerstones
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 1543 East Old Topside Rd, Louisville, TN 37777

Color photograph of three cornerstones inlaid into brick. The cornerstones progress chronologically from right to left. Inscriptions read: "Mt. Zion A.M.E. Zion Church; Laid Sept. 1904; Rev. M.M. Morris, Pastor." "Mt. Zion A.M.E. Zion Church; Built 1904 by M.M. Morris; Rebuilt 1929 by Rev. Ella B. Robinson, Pastor." "Moved and Rebuilt 1942 by Rev. M.H. Smith, Pastor."

Established in September of 1904, Mt. Zion AME Zion Church provided the African-American community of Louisville with a place of worship and a school. During the first stage of the church's development, Reverend M.M. Morris served as pastor. In 1929, the church was rebuilt under the leadership of Reverend Ella B. Robinson. Yet again, in 1942, the church moved to a new location under the leadership of Reverend M.H. Smith. Indicative of the many stages of the church's development, the current building reflects different construction periods and materials.
